result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher James Vick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Case Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term and proof supplied of an Associate's Degree, the Court will order expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Defendant is to complete any programming necessary to obtain an Associate's Degree through the Wisconsin Technical College System.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: No Good Time or Credit for prior time served.  Huber Privileges granted.  Court has no objection to transfer of sentence to another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristopher James Vick

RN with attached note

Case Called @ 2:15 PM: Defendant Kristopher James Vick in court with attorney Robert J. Sisson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint Agreement on resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 2 (POT):  NC  Plea Ct 3 (POP):  NC  Plea Ct 4 (Illegal RX):  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC to all 3 Counts.   Ct No 1 DRI.  Argument by DA:  As to cond'l time of 20 days for Ct No 2.  Expungement has not been raised by Defense, State would more than likely not object to future expungement.  Options program has been completed.  Argument by Atty Sisson - would argue for expungement and possible I/S sentence if necessary.  Statement by Def:  Yes.   The Court:  State's request is reasonable and Court also agrees with remarks of Atty Sisson.  Consequence required for these offenses.  Ct 2:  6 mos WCJ - I/S; Ct 3:  30 days I/S,  concurrent to Ct 2; Ct 4  6 mos WCJ - I/S - all concurrent to one another - with Huber, GT and no TS credit.  S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:  5 days WCJ, Huber - No GT or TS Report 5/1/15 @ 8:00 pm as to Ct No 2; AODA ordered as a formality and follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; to Complete the programming necessary to obtain an Assoc Degree thru the WI Technical College System - if nursing or another vocation - vocation up to Defendant, if successfully completed probation and obtained a degree, Court would expunge record as requested.  Court believes that degree would be accomplished in approx 21 mos.  No objection to serving sentence in another jurisdiction if can be arranged; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 9:38 a.m. Defendant Kristopher James Vick in court with attorney Robert J. Sisson.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Atty Sisson requesting clarification of the bond conditions. Atty Sisson inquiring as to whether the defendant can travel outside of the country. No objection by DA Blader. The court states that there is nothing in the bond that would prohibit the defendant from traveling out of the country.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 02:25 pm.
